pullRequest.title: #1929 introduce a SimpleUpgradeableModel
pullRequest.bodyText:
GitHub issue resolved: #1929 
Briefly describe the changes proposed in this PR:

Use SimpleUpgradeableModel in Changeset which will upgrade from a HashSet to a Model if it encounters queries that it can't answer.
Adding 1000 statements in SNAPSHOT takes ~6 ms instead of ~9ms

commit.message:
#1929 introduce a SimpleUpgradeableModel that uses a Set unless more functionality is needed

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

#1929 fixed a bug in the code

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

#1929 more efficient clear and correct handling of remove if any params are null

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

nodes.bodyText: This fixes a bug I believe I've introduced previously. Not a problem until now though.

commit.message:
#1929 null pointer expection fix

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

#1929 implemented some tests and fixed some tests that assumed ordering without specifying ordering

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

nodes.bodyText: There were tests that assumed an order but didn't specify one. The new ConcurrentHashSet based model has reverse order from the LinkedHashSet based one. I think this is fine, unless there is some internal ordering requirement that I don't know about???
Can we put a bit of javadoc in that describes the purpose and design rationale of this class?
How is this fix related to the new SimpleUpgradeableModel class?

commit.message:
#1929 moved to same location as other classes and integrated into tests

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

#1929 use the same way to distinguish if the statement is in the snapshot as the rest of the code

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>
